definitions.definition: To make foolproof.
definitions.example: We foolproofed the operations.

definitions.definition: For a device: protected, or designed to be proof against misuse or error.
For an idea or plan: infallible, or bulletproof.
One of the large beads in the rosary at which the paternoster is recited.
Very showy or ornamented, now especially when excessive, or in a tasteless or vulgar manner
Fun; merry; festive
A reunion held by one of the colleges of the University of Oxford for alumni, normally held during the summer vacations.
A descent in mountaineering using a rope looped at the top and a friction device.
To descend a steep or vertical drop using a rope with a mechanical friction device or (classic abseil) by wrapping the rope around the body; to rappel.
One who explores something
A person who by means of travel (notably an expedition) searches out new information.
Any of various hand tools, with sharp points, used in dentistry.
A visual representation of a file system etc. through which the user can navigate.
Careless, hasty writing, doodle or drawing
To write or draw carelessly and in a hurry
To doodle
To card or tease (wool) coarsely; to run through a scribbler.
Any of several waterbirds in the cosmopolitan family Podicipedidae. They have strong, sharp bills, and lobate toes.
The sport of flying in a hang glider.
A large Eurasian thrush, Turdus viscivorus.
The time it takes the Earth to pass once around the Sun, as reckoned with respect to the seasons and not the fixed stars (for instance from vernal equinox to vernal equinox).

(by extension) The time it takes for any astronomical object (such as a planet, dwarf planet, small Solar System body, or comet) in direct orbit around a star (such as the Sun) to make one revolution around the star, taking into account orbital precession.
Of or relating to construction or to architecture
Structural
Of, relating to, or caused by large-scale movements of the Earth's lithosphere
Momentous, utter, vast
A type of confectionery made by boiling sugar (or treacle, etc) with butter or milk, then cooling the mixture so that it becomes hard
A small, individual piece of toffee
definitions.example: a box of toffees

definitions.definition: Any kind of sweets; candy
To coat in toffee.
The aurora of the northern hemisphere.
A couch.
A compartment on a passenger train having berths for sleeping.
A berth in such a compartment.
To cause or to come to a deadlock.
A person who conducts an auction on behalf of a vendor, taking bids to find the best price for the vendor.
To sell at an auction; to auction.
One who studies musicology.
To become more likeable to someone.
definitions.example: I didn't like this song at first, but now it's starting to grow on me.

definitions.definition: To gradually become more evident to someone.
A pungent green Japanese condiment made from the plant Eutrema japonicum (formerly Wasabia japonica).
An imitation of this condiment made from horseradish with green dye.
A colubrid snake, from any of three genera, characterized by an upturned snout and notorious for playing dead when threatened.
A system of viewing individual television programmes for an additional charge over and above that for the standard service; normally used on cable and satellite systems.
To move about aimlessly, or on a winding course
To walk for pleasure; to amble or saunter.
To talk or write incessantly, unclearly, or incoherently, with many digressions.
definitions.example: Francine has a tendency to ramble when it gets to be late in the evening.

definitions.definition: A long meandering talk with no specific topic or direction.
A gentle hike.
Of a speech: meandering, long and digressing.
Confused and irregular; awkward.
A sensitive elongated erectile organ at the anterior part of the vulva in female humans and mammals, homologous with the penis.
A similar erectile sexual organ present in the cloacas of female ratites.
To strike or bump (someone or something) out.
definitions.example: I accidentally knocked out the glass in my picture frame.

definitions.definition: To render unconscious, as by a blow to the head.
definitions.example: The boxer knocked out his opponent in the third round.

definitions.definition: To put to sleep.
definitions.example: The allergy pill knocked him out for a good three hours.

definitions.definition: To exhaust.
definitions.example: Running errands all day really knocked him out.

definitions.definition: To complete, especially in haste; knock off.
definitions.example: They knocked out the entire project in one night.

definitions.definition: To cause a mechanism to become non-functional by damaging or destroying it.
definitions.example: The antitank gun knocked out the enemy tank.

definitions.definition: To eliminate.
To communicate (a message) by knocking.
definitions.example: The prisoner knocked out a message on the wall for the prisoner in the adjoining cell.

definitions.definition: To lose the scent of hounds in fox-hunting.
(Oxford University slang) To leave college after hours—after half-past ten at night when the doors has been locked.
Someone or something that has no hope of success.
A company that engages in no substantive business activities, but instead exists as a vehicle for legal or financial transactions, typically to shield another party from liability or other issues.
A membranous envelope.
A type of simple, dehiscent, dry fruit (seed-case) produced by many species of flowering plants, such as poppy, lily, orchid, willow and cotton.
A sporangium, especially in bryophytes.
A tough, fibrous layer surrounding an organ such as the kidney or liver
A membrane that surrounds the eyeball
A detachable part of a rocket or spacecraft (usually in the nose) containing the crew's living space.
A small container containing a dose of medicine.
In a brief, condensed or compact form
The covering — formerly lead or tin, now often plastic — over the cork at the top of the wine bottle.
A small clay saucer for roasting or melting samples of ores, etc.; a scorifier.
A small, shallow evaporating dish, usually of porcelain.
A small cup or shell, often of metal, for a percussion cap, cartridge, etc.
To form (medicine, etc.) into capsules.
To encapsulate or summarize.
To make someone or something immune to something.
To inoculate someone, and thus produce immunity from a disease.
A sport played on a field between two opposing teams using sticks (crosses) and a ball, whereby one team defeats the other by achieving a higher score by scoring goals within the allotted time.
The well-being of a community.
The entirety of a (secular) society, a polity, a state.
Republic. Often capitalized, as Commonwealth.
The narrow portion that forms the pouring spout of a bottle; the neck of a bottle.
In traffic, any narrowing of the road, especially resulting in a delay.
(by extension) The part of a process that is too slow or cumbersome.
definitions.example: It is easy to create entries; processing the paperwork is the bottleneck.

definitions.definition: To slow by causing a bottleneck.
definitions.example: The merge bottlenecked the traffic every morning.

definitions.definition: To form a bottleneck.
definitions.example: The traffic bottlenecked at the merge every morning.

definitions.definition: To induct into office with a formal ceremony.
To dedicate ceremoniously; to initiate something in a formal manner.
Invested with office; inaugurated.
An animal or plant that has been domesticated.
To make domestic.
To make fit for domestic life.
To adapt to live with humans.
definitions.example: The Russian claims to have successfully domesticated foxes.

definitions.definition: To adapt to live with humans.
definitions.example: Dogs have clearly domesticated more than cats.

definitions.definition: To make a legal instrument recognized and enforceable in a jurisdiction foreign to the one in which the instrument was originally issued or created.
To amend the elements of a text to fit local culture.
The segregation of people of different colour or race, especially any barrier to black people participating in activities with white people.
A pattern of varying tonal density that enables visual and numeric comparisons to be made across multiple printed sheets or pages.
(jewellery) In a rough opal: a layer of good jewellery-quality opal.
The calculus that deals with instantaneous rates of change.
Having a neat, smart appearance
Grandmother
The countdown and launch of a rocket, missile or spacecraft
A journey made to a sacred place, or a religious journey.
definitions.example: In the Muslim faith, the pilgrimage to Mecca is known as the Hajj.

definitions.definition: (by extension) A visit to any site revered or associated with a meaningful event.
definitions.example: Each year we made a pilgrimage to New York City to visit the pub where we all first met.

definitions.definition: To go on a pilgrimage.
A soft, white, powdery limestone.
A piece of chalk, or nowadays processed compressed gypsum, that is used for drawing and for writing on a blackboard.
Tailor's chalk.
A white powdery substance used to prevent hands slipping from holds when climbing, sometimes but not always limestone-chalk.
A platoon-sized group of airborne soldiers.
(horseracing) The favorite in a sporting event.
The prediction that there will be no upsets, and the favored competitor will win.
To apply chalk to anything, such as the tip of a billiard cue.
To record something, as on a blackboard, using chalk.
To use powdered chalk to mark the lines on a playing field.
To record a score or event, as if on a chalkboard.
To manure (land) with chalk.
To make white, as if with chalk; to make pale; to bleach.
To leave the country in which one lives, especially one's native country, in order to reside elsewhere.
One who visits a cinema in order to watch a film.
A thin slice of meat, especially veal or poultry.
A charge (depiction) of the scallop.
(initialism) Carbon copy.
(initialism) Closed caption.
(initialism) Courtesy copy.
(initialism) Cubic centimeter.
To add an additional recipient to the CC line of an e-mail message.
(authorship) One of the main sections into which the text of a book is divided.
definitions.example: Detective novel writers try to keep up the suspense until the last chapter.

definitions.definition: A section of a social or religious body.
A sequence (of events), especially when presumed related and likely to continue.
A decretal epistle.
A location or compartment.
The fatty tissue that surrounds and protects the kidneys; that of sheep and cattle is used in cooking and in making tallow.
To wear too many clothes for a particular occasion.
To wear clothing which is too elaborate or formal for a particular occasion.
Wearing too many clothes for the weather or the occasion.
Wearing clothes too formal or too elaborate for the occasion.
One who has committed the act of arson, or illegally setting fire to property.
A medical condition in which the sufferer experiences seizures (or convulsions) and blackouts.
Any of a class of diseases that appear to increase in frequency as countries become more industrialized and people live longer.
To make angry.
To make insane; to inflame with passion.
To become furious.
Causing frustration or anger.
Leading to insanity.
As in a dream; resembling a dream.
Sexy; handsome; attractive
definitions.example: I love the doctor in that American TV show: he is so dreamy!

definitions.definition: Having a pleasant or romantic atmosphere.
definitions.example: That place was so dreamy!

definitions.definition: Tending to dream or daydream.
A long, narrow, deep inlet between cliffs.
A metal rod, generally of wrought iron, for adjusting the burning logs or coals in a fire; a firestick.
A tool like a soldering iron for making poker drawings.
One who pokes.
A kind of duck, the pochard.

Any of various card games in which, following each of one or more rounds of dealing or revealing cards, the players in sequence make tactical bets or drop out, the bets forming a pool to be taken either by the sole remaining player or, after all rounds and bets have been completed, by those remaining players who hold a superior hand according to a standard ranking of hand values for the game.
All the four cards of the same rank.
Any imagined frightful object, especially one supposed to haunt the darkness; a bugbear.
A type of music common in the Caribbean, originally associated with the Dominican Republic.
A song performed in this style.
A dance to this style of music.
To dance to merengue music.
The turning or bending of any wave, such as a light or sound wave, when it passes from one medium into another of different optical density.
The degree to which a metal or compound can withstand heat
A violent collision or shock.
An injury to part of the body, most especially the brain, caused by a violent blow, followed by loss of function.
The unlawful forcing of another by threats of violence to yield up something of value.
Direct, one-to-one.
Facing one another.
Directly, one-to-one.
The season of spring, between winter and summer.
With a breeze blowing, with a lively wind, pleasantly windy.
With a cheerful, casual, lively and light-hearted manner.
A person who commits murder.
To fish excessively, often substantially reducing over several years the supply of one or more species of fish in an area.
Fishing that reduces the stock of remaining fish in an area to below that which is acceptable.
An unmarried noblewoman who was the attendant of a queen or princess
The chief bridesmaid at a wedding
A voluntary break from the use of computer technology, electronic devices and the Internet, intended to benefit people who spend an excessive amount of time using such technology.
A singer; a person who likes to sing.
(grammar) A change in the form of a word that reflects a change in grammatical function.
definitions.example: an inflection for gender, number, or tense

definitions.definition: A change in pitch or tone of voice.
A change in curvature from concave to convex or from convex to concave.
A turning away from a straight course.
(optometry) diffraction
To refuse to own, or to refuse to acknowledge one’s own.
definitions.example: Lord Capulet and his wife threatened to disown their daughter Juliet if she didn’t go through with marrying Count Paris.

definitions.definition: To repudiate any connection to; to renounce.
To detach (a job or process) so that it can continue to run even when the user who launched it ends his/her login session.
Reserved, engaged.
definitions.example: The stall on the left is occupied.

definitions.definition: Busy, unavailable.
definitions.example: She is occupied at the moment.

definitions.definition: Subjugated, under the control of a foreign military presence.
definitions.example: My father travelled to occupied Japan in December 1945.

definitions.definition: (of time) To take or use.
To take or use space.
To have sexual intercourse with.
To do business in; to busy oneself with.
To use; to expend; to make use of.
Someone who has coeliac disease.
Relating to the abdomen, or to the cavity of the abdomen.
Abbreviation of coeliac disease; used attributively.
Allowing movement in only one direction; unidirectional.
definitions.example: The town centre is now a system of one-way streets.

definitions.definition: Allowing travel in only one direction.
definitions.example: I bought a one-way ticket to Leeds.

definitions.definition: A building serving as the headquarters of a branch of the police force, and sometimes as a temporary place of confinement for offenders.
To ruin unintentionally.
definitions.example: The terrorists have really mucked up our holiday plans.

definitions.definition: To clown around; to have fun, often at the expense of others.
definitions.example: It's the last day of school and everyone is mucking up.

definitions.definition: (retail) A bin filled with products of a particular type, often at a discount, without any stacking or arrangement.
One who lives alone, or in solitude; an anchoret, hermit or recluse.
Solitary confinement.
definitions.example: The prisoners who started the riot were moved to solitary.

definitions.definition: Living or being by oneself; alone; having no companion present
Performed, passed, or endured alone
definitions.example: a solitary journey

definitions.definition: Not much visited or frequented; remote from society
definitions.example: a solitary residence or place

definitions.definition: Not inhabited or occupied; without signs of inhabitants or occupation; desolate; deserted
definitions.example: the solitary desert

definitions.definition: Gloomy; dismal, because of not being inhabited.
Single; individual; sole.
definitions.example: a solitary example

definitions.definition: Not associated with others of the same kind.
The Rodrigues solitaire (Pezophaps solitaria), an extinct flightless bird.
To cause an intense dislike for something.
definitions.example: It disgusts me to see her chew with her mouth open.

definitions.definition: Filled with disgust
definitions.example: The sight of the squirming mass of maggots left me disgusted.

definitions.definition: Irritated and out of patience
definitions.example: I'm disgusted with her egocentric behaviour.

definitions.definition: A linguistic sound other than a stop.
A determinant formed from a tridiagonal matrix.
(ontology) An endurant.
Continuing; prolonged; sustained.
definitions.example: a continuant sound

definitions.definition: To release government control of (a business or industry) to private industry.
To make (a variable, etc.) private in scope.
One who runs a shop, either the owner or manager.
One who is in charge of stores or goods of any kind.
definitions.example: a naval storekeeper

definitions.definition: Any unsaleable item.
Baggy, not tight
